title: Implement torch.einsum (fixes #1889)
body_html:
This provides a simple implementation of einsum. It is built on top of the work for computing bilinear (#6110) and would obsolete PR #2008.
Properties:

  • Implemented from scratch, but I used the tests from (@rockt)[https://gist.github.com/rockt/15ee013889d65342088e9260a377dc8f], including the fixme's.
  • The obvious unsupported features are taking diagonals (einsum('ii->i',(a,)) and ellipses.

Implementation:

  • It uses a naive left-to-right pairwise contractions at the moment.
  • Backward works automagically.
  • I had to complete the strings implementation in the python-ATen interface.

body:
This provides a simple implementation of einsum. It is built on top of the work for computing bilinear (#6110) and would obsolete PR #2008.
Properties:
- Implemented from scratch, but I used the tests from (@rockt)[https://gist.github.com/rockt/15ee013889d65342088e9260a377dc8f], including the fixme's.
- The obvious unsupported features are taking diagonals (einsum('ii->i',(a,)) and ellipses.

Implementation:
- It uses a naive left-to-right pairwise contractions at the moment.
- Backward works automagically.
- I had to complete the strings implementation in the python-ATen interface.
